acts.title: Act 1 — First Exchange
steps: You arrive to pick up your child, but your ex seems upset.
They start speaking in a confusing or emotional way.
Choose: stay calm, ignore, or react emotionally.

acts.title: Act 2 — Escalation
steps: The discussion grows tense; voices rise.
Your child notices and becomes unsettled.
Options: de‑escalate gently, suggest a short break, or argue back.

acts.title: Act 3 — Resolution
steps: Depending on choices: a compromise, unresolved tension, or worsened conflict.
If you stayed calm, your child feels reassured.
If you escalated, the conflict lingers and your child feels stressed.
